title: 115_hr4515
content: CHIP Allocation Redistribution Special Rule for Certain Shortfall States during First Quarter of Fiscal Year 2018. Section 2104(f)(2) of the Social Security Act is amended to determine redistributed amounts if insufficient amounts are available. If the amounts for redistribution are less than the estimated shortfalls for a fiscal year, the redistribution amount for each shortfall State will be reduced proportionally. A special rule applies for the first quarter of fiscal year 2018. For fiscal year 2018, the Secretary will redistribute amounts to emergency shortfall States equal to their shortfall, with adjustments as needed. The Secretary will redistribute amounts to shortfall States, with adjustments as needed. Emergency shortfall States are defined as those with a shortfall for the period. The Secretary will redistribute amounts to shortfall States for the period beginning October 1, 2017, and ending December 31, 2017, based on estimated projected expenditures under the State child health plan and section 2105(g). The Secretary will redistribute amounts to shortfall States for the period beginning October 1, 2017, and ending December 31, 2017, based on estimated projected expenditures under the State child health plan and section 2105(g). A shortfall State may qualify as an emergency shortfall State without considering any redistributed amounts before the date of enactment for fiscal year 2018. During fiscal year 2018, a qualifying State can apply for a specific option under section 2105(g)(4) as if references to 2017 were replaced with 2018. Additionally, subsections (e), (f), and (m) of the section are referenced, with a new subparagraph added for rule of construction regarding commonwealths or territories described in subsection (c)(3) being treated as shortfall States or emergency shortfall States.
